intro: Tetracera philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine tetracera, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds, and it is often found in lowland to montane forest habitats. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
